asset_get_type: With this function you can get the type of asset being referenced from its name (a string). One of the constants listed below will be returned.
The name of the game asset to get the type of (a string).
The given name refers to an object.
The given name refers to a sprite.
The given name refers to a sound.
The given name refers to a room.
The given name refers to a tile set.
The given name refers to a path.
The given name refers to a script.
The given name refers to a font.
The given name refers to a time line.
The given name refers to a shader.
The given name refers to an Animation Curve.
The given name refers to a Sequence.
The given name refers to an asset that either does not exist, or is not one of the above listed.

{ANY_CODE} if asset_get_type("pth_Path_" + string(global.Game)) == asset_unknown
{nbsp_x4}{
{nbsp_x4}show_debug_message("Path doesn't exist!!!");
{nbsp_x4}}
else
{nbsp_x4}{
{nbsp_x4}path_index = asset_get_index("pth_Path_" + string(global.Game));
{nbsp_x4}}

The above code checks a dynamically created asset name to see if the asset is of the correct type. If it is not, then a debug message will be shown, otherwise the asset name is used to assign the asset to the instance.
